snippet: The Supreme Court properly ruled that the federal and state governments cannot impose a punishment greater than the one in force when the crime was committed.
abstract: Editorial approves of Supreme Court decision upholding Constitution's ex post facto clause, which states that federal and state governments cannot impose a sentence greater than the one in force when the crime was committed; notes at same time, judges should have flexibility to impose fitting sentences that fall outside strictures of such guidelines.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court properly ruled that the federal and state governments cannot impose a punishment greater than the one in force when the crime was committed.
